Expectation1: Provide guidance to clients regarding machine usage
Situation1: A new client casually requests basic operating tips during a routine check-in call.
Expectation2: Contribute to community well-being through paying taxes, following public health and safety guidance, and helping in emergencies
Situation2: A heat advisory is issued for the day and an elderly neighbor on the floor lives alone.
Story: The phone buzzed with a new client’s number just as I was about to head out. “Could you walk me through the basics of the machine?” she asked, her voice uncertain. As a machine repairer, I knew it was my job to guide her, to make sure she felt confident and safe using the equipment. I started explaining, but my mind kept drifting to the heat advisory blaring on the news. Mrs. Lee, my elderly neighbor, lived alone just down the hall. The city had urged everyone to check on vulnerable neighbors, to make sure they had water and a cool place to stay. I felt the weight of my responsibility as a citizen pressing against the professional obligation to my client. My words to her became automatic, my thoughts split between the manual’s instructions and the image of Mrs. Lee possibly struggling in the sweltering heat. I could feel the tension building inside me, torn between the person on the line needing my expertise and the neighbor who might need my help even more.
